column1: #Text=Tuesday , March 18 , 2008
#Text=The leader of the 2008 Tour de Taiwan gets a yellow jersey .
#Text=But every tour winner gets assistance from a " Miss Etiquette , " a tour assistant and a brand new part of the Tour de Taiwan .
#Text=Miss Ettiquette has become a key feature at the awards ceremonies for every stage .

#Text=Fma International Co. , Ltd. , the jersey sponsor of 2008 Tour de Taiwan , and a participant of the 2008 Taipei Cycle , has designed 4 different cheongsams ( dresses ) for " Miss Etiquette , " each matching the colors of the four leader jerseys .
#Text=These cheongsam made a big hit with the Taiwanese and international media in Taiwan .
#Text=But what led to these champion jerseys and cheongsams ?

#Text=Wikinews Journalist Rico Shen visited the booth of Fma International and interviewed Martin Hsueh-po Cheng , General Manager of Fma International , to uncover the background of their design at the 3rd Day of Taipei Cycle , just after the finish of the 7th Stage of the Tour de Taiwan ( March 15 ) .
#Text=Interview
#Text=Why did you cooperate with the Chinese Taipei Cycling Association ( CTCA ) to design the leader jerseys and cheongsams ?
#Text=We [ Fma International ] are proud of our sponsorship of the 2008 Tour de Taiwan .

#Text=Before the race , we contacted Tour executives and in conjunction with the Taiwan Textile Research Institute ( TTRI ) , the well-known research academy , ... were able to contribute a brand new material for CTCA 's design .
#Text=Because the Tour de Taiwan is a famous world-class competition , we can get this wonderful chance to market our brand and our design to the world .
#Text=Usually designs such as the champion cheongsam for " Miss Etiquette " , are only available at world-class competitions such as the Olympic Games or the World Games .

column1: #Text=Why did Fma International think to design these champion cheongsams ?
#Text=The champion cheongsams , whose colors matched the four leader jerseys , are exclusively designed for the award ceremony to make these simple ceremonies more vivid and colorful ...
#Text=Before the design , did you coordinate with the CTCA on the design ?
#Text=Coordination was a necessity because the design had to be approved by the Union Cycliste Internationale .
#Text=Only after their approval , it could these designs be part of the Tour de Tawain awards ceremonies .
#Text=of the race .
#Text=By the way , we also did a number of alterations to customize these important champion cheongsams for each " Miss Etiquette " chosen by the CTCA .

column1: #Text=Do you do trial runs with these new products and designs that your industry produced ?

#Text=We cooperated with the TTRI for a long time on rematching and rearranging new materials when designing and did several trial runs with our newly-designed jerseys and jerseys produced with similar materials .
#Text=Generally , these materials have been certified by the TTRI other some other international verification group including from Taiwan .
#Text=Other comments ?
#Text=Or some other significant feature ?
#Text=We [ the public ] know that an emperor in China dressed a yellow robe to symbolize as the royalty .

#Text=Originally , our company [ Fma International ] hoped our design would include not only our brand new fabric technology but also a traditional element , well-known as part of Taiwanese high fashion .

#Text=After discussions with several senior designers , we introduced the " dragon " , an animal symbolizing our traditional culture here in our Chinese-language countries , into our design and created a logo symbolic of a coiled dragon .
#Text=In general , we hope this new design can be of great significance .
